netapp_volumes_dashboard_connection_sett: Add IP addresses or ranges authorised to access this volume.
Choose the access type: “Read only” and “Read/Write”
If you need more than one access rule, repeat step 2.
netapp_volumes_dashboard_connection_inst: Open an SSH client and connect to your server
On Red Hat Enterprise Linux and SuSE Linux
netapp_volumes_dashboard_mount_file_syst: To keep the mount on reboot, add to the /etc/fstab file
netapp_volumes_dashboard_volume_name_upd: The volume name has been updated.
netapp_volumes_dashboard_volume_descript: The volume description has been updated.
netapp_volumes_dashboard_volume_name_upd: An error has occurred updating the volume name.
netapp_volumes_dashboard_volume_descript: An error has occurred updating the volume description.
netapp_volumes_dashboard_volume_pattern: May only contain numbers, letters, underscores, dashes or full stops, and a maximum of 256 characters.
